Name: Pre-Northridge WUF-B beam-column joint, beam one side of column, beam depth <= W27

GeneralInformation.Description: Costing is on a per bay basis.  Costing does not include fireproofing removal or reapplication cost.
GeneralInformation.Author: Greg Deierlein

DamageStates.Description: Fracture of lower beam flange weld and failure of web bolts (shear tab connection), with fractures confined to the weld region.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: Repair will typically require gouging out and re-welding of the beam flange weld, repair of shear tab, and replacing shear bolts.

DamageStates.Description: Similar to DS1, except that fracture propagates into column flanges.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: DESCRIPTION IS NOT COMPLETE:  In addition to column measures for DS1, repairs to column will be necessary that will involve replacing a portion of the ….

DamageStates.Description: Fracture of upper beam flange weld, without DS1 type damage.  Fracture is confined to beam flange region.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: Repairs will be similar to those required for DS1, except that access to weld will likely require removal of a portion of the floor slab above the weld.

DamageStates.Description: Similar to DS3, except that fracture propagates into column flanges.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: In addition to column measures for DS3, repairs to column will be necessary that will involve replacing a portion of the column flange.

DamageStates.Description: Fracture initiating at weld access hole and propagating through beam flange, possibly accompanied by local buckling deformations of web and flange.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: Repair is similar to that for DS1 except that a portion of the beam web and flange may need to be heat straightened or replaced.
